Reviews.Title: “Good location, Nice apartments, but terrible reception staff”
Reviews.Author: pakistanitraveller
Reviews.Content: Easy to book, good location, but the downside was the reception staff..very aloof, got us waiting for 2 hours while the rooms were cleaned..our protests fell to dead ears..they would just go inside and not come out while people bickered. even the manager disappeared. one more thing, if you are looking for free internet, you might as well forget it.....its the slowest i have ever seen in dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money!!!”
Reviews.Author: vshrishrimal
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five days in December 2011... Good location connected well by all means like metro, bus and taxi.... Centrally located and all amenities are nearby like Banks, Grocery and all other necessities... Good sized rooms and courteous staff.... Best part is nice food available nearby the hotel.... Great value for money hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Great appartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: bramhabull
Reviews.Content: Simply the best and well located. Loved the location, service and main thing is the food. breakfast and dinner was great. Other indian restaraunts are closeby and at easy walkable distance There are bars also nearby. It is just another home When you visit Dubai don't forget to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: pel579
Reviews.Content: we had a 2 bed appartment which also included a laundry. water was leaking out of the laundry, which I notified reception about. after 20 mins waiting we gave up and went out. when we came back we contacted them again. 20 mins later maintenance arrived, looked at it, scratched the head tried turning off taps and put a mat outside the laundry door to soak up the leaking water. that was there solution. by the next day the mat was soaking wet. we also found the bathroom to be disgusting and there was no toilet paper or towels and the soap look like it had be re-used.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: bmstrip
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Dubai umpteen number of times but took my family on a holiday to Dubai for the first time in May 2011. I read many reviews, where most of them rated this hotel as below average. But I beg to differ. I had booked an apartment of 1 bedroom for 5 days through the internet online, which included complimentary breakfast and airport pickup and drop. We were greeted by the chauffeur at the airport on time and very cozily dropped at the hotel. The first surprise was that I was upgraded to a 2 bedroom apartment which was huge and very clean. The air condition was so strong that we had to switch it off most of the time in the nights, absolutely the opposite of what I had heard. The food was good but the choices were almost the same every day. My family enjoyed the stay thoroughly.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience - Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst experiences I had, staying in a Hotel Apartment in Dubai (and I ahve used many). I faced the following problems: 1 - The couches were stained and dirty. They were in fact, so dirty that I could not bring myself to sit on them (I have pictures to prove it) 2- First night I was there, I noticed my room did not have towels. I asked the front-desk to send up some since I wanted to take a shower before I turned in for the night. An hour after I called, no towels. I called them again, and they said all the towels were in the laundry, they were waiting to receive the clean ones. Ultimately, I went to bed, and called them up again in the morning, and asked them to send up the towels. The front-office guy thought it was okay to slam down the phone without saying "yes" or "no", but the towels did show up in 10 minutes. 3- The bathroom floor had bugs. Yup, a number of itty bitty dead insects. I think they died from the trauma of being in that little dirty bathroom. 4- The hotel promises a fully equipped kitchen, and a washing machine. Guess what, the kitchen was not equipped with anything other than a kitchen table, and there was an open drain in the kitchen (which solved the mystery of where the insects came from). 5- There was probably a washing machine in the room above mine, which was, for some reason, being operated at 2 in the morning. The rumbling kept me awake that night. 6- The corridor stank. 7- It was impossible to get a cellphone signal, unless I was half hanging out of the window. This was not the fault of the telecom service provider - because it was not possible to get a signal for either of the two UAE operators (Etisalat and Du). In all fairness, this is something the hotel probably cannot help. So there you go. Unless your other option is sleeping on the street, try and avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Property In the Middle of The Dubai...... Everything Manage Your Self”
Reviews.Author: parthik
Reviews.Content: Really value for your money Property..... Two BHK 350dhs is worth in the heart of the city, nice swimming pool, gym....... the problem is all you have to do by your own....... service is horrible... terrible........ it make you waiting ..... waiting..... if you call House Keeping for Towel @ 7.30am....... gave them 2 reminders @ 7.55 & 8.10 then you have to go to your room corridor & take the towel from the house keeping trolley lying there without attendant...... B/f Tea & Om late ----- waiting time almost 1hr n 2 reminder calls....... thats not good as you have to leave early for the business meetings......... over all the hotel is perfect but service is really poor.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Ram1968
Reviews.Content: I stayed in LC1 for 3 days. Hotel Corridor is having some smell. Cable quality is very bad. Kitchen is not that much good. It's OK to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money...”
Reviews.Author: bigidea089
Reviews.Content: Today 26th/Nov/2010 I am here from last three days and for next 2 days. Working on 7 days business project... Hired place to avoid long travel and traffic. Likes : Only rates as per area of the hotel Dislikes: At night internet is very very very slow.... Can't work from net., Location : Taxis are not easily available, requested receptionist to call taxi, not co-operative, Nearest metro station is also around 20 Minutes far., Hotel has only three lifts in lobby... big walk from lift to room.

Reviews.Title: “London Crown 1 at Dubai has gone to seed!”
Reviews.Author: krishg40
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 years ago and it was a much better place. It has since gone to seed. I just returned on 19th Nov 2010 after a 5 day stay. Rooms are smelly. Need a coat of paint badly. They say its a furnished apartment but I had to request for all the key items and chase the hotel staff for it. All the items that were supplied were stained, chipped and with paint peeling - oven, toaster, kettle etc etc. The hotel was running full due to Eid and the service was tardy. Their overall attitude was "What's with you? Do you know we are running full?" I wouldn't go back here to stay. The location is a killer but you have several properties that can give better service in this area. Some that I can reel off are Golden Sands, Savoy Park / Suites / Crest and the newly opened CityMax Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL APARTMENT”
Reviews.Author: punmad
Reviews.Content: This is a very good spacious hotel apartment with a mixed room style of 1 bed 2 bed and 3 bedroom. I stayed in the 1 bedroom which is very spacious and has all the amenities for a furnished hotel apartment with a nice swimming pool and a nice coffee shop and a fitness center too. It is very close to the bank street and has a lot of restaurants in its vicinity. A good place to stay with family and you feel at home as the rooms are quite spacious and have all the amenities you need

Reviews.Title: “USED TO BE A GOOD PROPERTY”
Reviews.Author: jayeshashar
Reviews.Content: Good location but has seen better days. Needs refurbishment and upgradation of basic facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious & clean, but dated furnishings and below average service..”
Reviews.Author: amjustadreamer
Reviews.Content: Well firstly, as someone pointed out in his review, most of the people describing London crown 1 as being grotty & unclean have confused it with London crown 2, which indeed is all that. London Crown 1 is located near to the four points sheraton hotel and the standard chartered bank off al mankhool road. London crown 2(the bad one) is located in bank street area(some 50 mtrs off the main street), near burjuman center. And if I am correct London crown 1 has 2BHK & 3BHK rooms while London crown 2 has studio & 1bhk rooms Now to the review of London Crown "1" Location : It is located in a quiet residential area off al mankool road, behind standard chartered bank. Its at a walkable distance(max 10mins) to departmental stores like spinneys and choitram , couple of decent malls,electronic shops like Jumbo and also apple store, a few nice restaurants(including KFC and Mcdonalds), and some pubs . And if you dont mind walking a bit more, then you could be in the awesome Mina bazaar after a leisurely walk of about 20 mins. And there is a convenient store right opposite to the hotel for all the daily requirements. Rooms: Well, when I walked in the room for the first time, my first words were - 'wow, thats big!'..I stayed in a 2 bhk room along with one of my office collegue. The living room was big with a LCD tv, comfy sofa set, and a dining table. The fabric of sofa set did look like it needed some urgent fresh fabric upgrade. The bedrooms had divinely comfortable queen sized double beds, CRT TVs and good storage arrangements. There were 2 bathrooms, one had a bathtub, while the other a separate shower area. Decent sized, simple, and clean. The room service did a great job daily to keep everything neat and clean. All in all rooms werespacious and clean, but the furnishings were relly outdated. Service: At times the room service was prompt and at times it gave me headaches. On my first night I asked them to give me a wakeup call at 6am as I had an important meeting..The next morning no one bothered to give me a call! Fortunately my cellphone alarm went off at 7 am , so I was only an hour late on my first day. One of the lady, who seemed to be from philippines, had a tough time comprehending english.Either they misunderstood what I wanted and brought something else, or they forgot it all together. Food: The chicken club sandwich for 23Dirhams was absolutely awesome.. I ordered it more than 20 times for about 45 days I stayed there ! The food was good, but it took really long to deliver. Sometimes it took more than an hour.There was a nice restaurant called Grand restaurant opposite to the hotel building, which served even better food (Indian, Chinese and continental) at about half the price!! We ate our dinner there almost every other day.Or you can always wander outside where there are many good lebanese, indian,continental and chinese restaurants. I didnt have to pay for my month and half stay here as I was on official business trip.I learnt however that it cost 800 Dhm per day /per room for my company..a little pricey I think taking into account the not-so-good service and outdated furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “a family hotel”
Reviews.Author: spml50093
Reviews.Content: a good hotel with good romms and above all a great location

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: luckyduck13
Reviews.Content: Bad smells in rooms when we arrived. Furniture & fittings very basic. Bathroom in urgent need of an update, not nice to use. The whole place could do with an 'extreme makeover'. Not recommended when there are plenty of other nicer apartment hotels in the area. Only positive was the breakfast wasn't too bad, but you paid 30dirhams whether you had tea and toast or the whole buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Confusion: London Crown 1 & 2”
Reviews.Author: mrken22
Reviews.Content: I suspect all of the earlier reviews are actually about London Crown 2! This is the one very close to the Bur Juman Shopping Centre, just along the road from “Bank Street”. It doesn't say outside that it is London Crown 2, but it is! London Crown 1 is actually further away from the Bur Juman Centre, still walkable, but a block or so behind the Ramada Hotel. Of the two, London Crown 1 is by far the superior. I know this because a mix up in booking in March forced me to move from LC2 to LC1, which is more expensive but it is well worth the extra money. London Crown 1 is located on a much quieter street, a ten minute walk from the shopping mall. The apartments are much bigger, much better maintained and much more luxurious. The kitchens are better equipped, but still with utensils missing. (Get used to it! This is such a common problem in Dubai's serviced apartments) There is a pool and nice little cafe for meals. . London Crown 2 does indeed have rather grotty studios with bad TV reception, appalling bathrooms and very poorly equipped kitchens. The big plus being it is only a two minute stroll from the Bur Juman Centre. Forget London Crown 2, go for London Crown 1 and put up with the extra walk to the shops

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: Travellerfrance
Reviews.Content: April 2005. The standard of accommodation is very low and certainly not up to normal tourist standards. The bathrooms and kitchens in particular are very shabby, rundown, dirty, poorly equipped. In addition, there is no pool in the hotel apartment block, only in the long term rented apartments which they do not let to tourists, even though the pool is advertised. The photos on websites advertising the apartments bear little relation to reality. The Reception admitted that they had given us a "bad room", but maintained there were some good rooms. Unfortunately they were unable to show or give us one.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the London Crown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: honourj
Reviews.Content: We are still reminiscing about our fantastic stay at the London Crown Hotel. Its location is very convenient being so close to the main road and shopping centers but still away from the noise and hustle and bustle of heavy traffic and pedestrians. The lay out of the studio flat was marvelous… very cozy and big, consisting of a nice table next to the window at which one can enjoy a romantic meal and a comfortable, plush sofa to relax in while sipping drinks and a queen size bed that was indeed very warm and inviting. The kitchen was opening out towards the bedroom and thankfully there was a door closing the kitchen compartment from the bedroom/living area so “when you walk out of your flat no you don’t smell of the food you just cooked!” The kitchen however can do a bit better with more equipment and it would have been nice if bottles of drinking water were provided so that the guests don’t have to go out the day you check in itself just to buy some water to drink. The breakfast was fantastic.. There was a spread of Western and Indian cuisine and it was scrumptious. Spending a couple of days at the London Crown and having breakfast at the same place we were skeptical as to whether we will be bored with the breakfast if it was the same thing, from the same place day in and day out, but it was not the case and we did not tire of the breakfast at all… it was simply wonderful and we really looked forward to it. The front desk staff could have been a bit more polite especially when it came to the complimentary airport transfer, which should be understood is something that the guest does not have to worry about. On the whole however, the staff were very good and attentive to all our needs. Paying $64 for the studio flat per night and that wonderful breakfast was really monies worth and we will surely pick the London Crown Hotel the next time around!

HotelInfo.Name: London Crown 1 Hotel Apartments
HotelInfo.Address: P.O. Box 31388, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
